alternation:
交替，轮流 
to place or do (different things) so that one follows the other in a repeated series
restrictive:
约束性的 
limiting or controlling someone or something
cavalier:
骑士； 
a gentleman trained in arms and horsemanship

漫不经心的，傲慢的 
having or showing no concern for something that is important or serious
falter:

to stop being strong or successful; to begin to fail or weaken

犹豫 
to feel doubt about doing something
hollow:
空洞的 
having nothing inside; not solid

形成空洞 
to form (something) by digging or cutting the inside of something
entertain:
抱有，怀着 想法、疑问等 
to have (a thought, idea, etc.) in your mind 
15
stem:
茎 
the main long and thin part of a plant that rises above the soil and supports the leaves and flowers

阻止，遏制，制止 
to stop the progress or spread of (something)
legislature:
立法机构 
a group of people with the power to make or change laws
slander:
口头诽谤；诋毁；中伤

admonish:
告诫 
to speak to (someone) in a way that expresses disapproval or criticism
infantile:
婴儿的 
affecting babies or very young children
inferior:
较差的；次的 
not as good as somebody/something else

级别低的；较低的 
of lower rank; lower

不如别人的人；级别或地位低的人 
a person who is not as good as somebody else; a person who is lower in rank or status
commend:
称赞 
to formally praise someone or something
ripple:

a small wave on the surface of a liquid

在 上形成涟漪 
to move in small waves
wail:
悲叹，哀号 
a long cry of sadness or pain

废黜国王或女王；撵下台；免 某人 的职；罢 某人 的官 
to remove a king or queen from power; to remove somebody from a position of authority 
or power 
16
deviate:
偏离，违背 
to do something that is different from the usual or common way of behaving

反常的

异常者

wry:
挖苦的，讽刺的，揶揄的 
humorous in a clever and often ironic way

歪斜的，扭曲的 
bent to one side
solicit:
请求给予金钱、帮助、支持等；征求意见 
to ask for (something, such as money or help) from people, companies, etc.
dilute:
稀释的 
reduced in strength as a result of containing an added liquid

稀释 
to make (a liquid) thinner or less strong by adding water or another liquid
exclusive:
排他的，独享的 
not shared; available to only one person or group

高档的，高级的，奢华的

aboriginal:
欧洲人到来之前某地区的人、动物等土著的，土生土长的 
relating to the original people, animals, etc. of a place and to a period of time before 
Europeans arrived

尤指澳大利亚的土著，土人 
a member of a race of people who were the original people living in a country, especially Australia
reckless:
鲁莽的 
not showing proper concern about the possible bad results of your actions
quixotic:
堂吉诃德式的，幻想的，不切实际的，空想的

indiscretion:

lack of good judgment or care in behavior and especially in speech; lack of discretion
retort:
生气或幽默地反驳，回嘴 
to reply quickly to a comment, in an angry, offended or humorous way 
17
astute:

having or showing an ability to notice and understand things clearly; mentally sharp or clever

derange:

边缘物，附加物 
something that is marginal, additional, or secondary to some activity, process, or subject

辅助的，补充的

葡萄酒优质的，上等的，佳酿的

过去某个时期典型的，优质的； 某人的最佳作品的

haven:

a place where you are protected from danger, trouble, etc.

incense:

to make (someone) very angry
entrench:

irrefutable:
无可辩驳的；不能推翻的；不容否认的

consisting of granules; grainy; coarse; resembling grain
implore:

to beg someone earnestly or desperately to do something

使丢脸；有辱 的人格；降低 的身份； 
to treat (someone or something) poorly and without respect

使恶化，使退化 
to make the quality of (something) worse
syntax:
句法，句法规则

过分突出的； 难看得显眼的，扎眼的

lurid:

embark:

get on board;to start something new or important
tantamount:
相当于；无异于 
being almost the same or having the same effect as something, usually something bad
ostensible:
假装的，表面的

levity:

cordial:
